# Abbreviations {-}

```{r abbreviations, eval=TRUE, include=TRUE, echo=FALSE, error=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

table <- tibble(
  
  Abbreviation = c(
    "BMI",
    "MR",
    "MVMR",
    "SNP",
    "PPAR-y",
    "WHR",
    "BF",
    "WHRadjBMI",
    "DXA",
    "WC",
    "WCadjBMI",
    "HC",
    "HCadjBMI",
    "CRP",
    "HDL",
    "TG",
    "FG",
    "CVD",
    "CHD",
    "IL",
    "CKD",
    "NAFLD",
    "TNF-alpha",
    "PCOS",
    "RCT",
    "MS",
    "NMR",
    "IV",
    "LD",
    "GWAS",
    "STROBE-MR",
    "OR",
    "SD",
    "SE",
    "CI",
    "Apo"
    
    
    ),
  
  Term = c(
    "Body mass index",
    "Mendelian randomization",
    "Multivariable Mendelian randomization",
    "Single nucleotide polymorphism",
    "Peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor-y",
    "Waist hip ratio",
    "Body fat percentage",
    "Waist hip ratio adjusted for body mass index",
    "Dual energy x-ray absorptiometry",
    "Waist circumference",
    "Waist circumference adjusted for body mass index",
    "Hip circumference",
    "Hip circumference adjusted for body mass index",
    "C reactive protein",
    "High-density lipoprotein",
    "Triglycerides",
    "Fasting glucose",
    "Cardiovascular disease",
    "Coronary heart disease",
    "Interleukin",
    "Chronic kidney disease",
    "Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease",
    "Tumour necrosis factor-alpha",
    "Polycystic ovary syndrome",
    "Randomised control trial",
    "Mass spectrometry",
    "Nuclear magnetic resonance",
    "Instrumental variable",
    "Linkage disequilibrium",
    "Genome-wide association study",
    "Strengthening the Reporting of Observational Studies in Epidemiology using Mendelian Randomization",
    "Odds ratio",
    "Standard deviation",
    "Standard error",
    "Confidence interval",
    "Apolipoprotein"
    
           )) %>%
  
  arrange(Term) # i.e. alphabetical order by Term

knitr::kable(table, longtable = T, booktabs = T, format = "latex", escape = F, digits = 2,
    row.names = F,
    col.names = c("Abbreviation","Term")) %>%
  kable_styling(latex_options = c("striped", "HOLD_position", "repeat_header"), position = "center") %>%
  column_spec(2, width = "30em")

```
